snippet: Sexual-minority teenagers are at far greater risk for depression, bullying and many types of violence than their straight peers, the C.D.C. has found....
abstract: Youth Risk Behavior Survey, administered by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention biennially, examines sexuality of high school students nationwide and finds that gay, lesbian and bisexual teenagers are at far greater risk for depression, bullying and violence than straight peers.
lead_paragraph: Sexual-minority teenagers are at far greater risk for depression, bullying and many types of violence than their straight peers, the C.D.C. has found.

headline.main: Gay and Lesbian High School Students Report ‘Heartbreaking’ Levels of Violence
headline.print_headline: Gay and Lesbian Youths Face Greater Risk of Violence

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
